Title.evidence: Feasibility of Systemic Lidocaine Infusion in Surgical ICU: A Pilot Study

Participants.evidence: Twelve adult patients admitted after open abdominal surgery were enrolled.

Intervention.evidence: A low-dose lidocaine infusion (10–30 mcg/kg/min) was initiated within 1 hour of ICU admission.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was feasibility, assessed through recruitment, retention, and withdrawal rates over a 6-month period.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Eighteen participants were screened, with 12 completing the study

Number_Analysed.evidence: 12 completing the study, resulting in a 66.7% retention rate

Result_Outcome.evidence: Pain scores decreased by 1.09 units per day (β = −1.09; 95% CI: −1.82 to −0.36; p = 0.003).

Harms.evidence: No serious adverse events were reported. Dizziness and hypertension were the most common adverse events, affecting 16.7% of patients each.
